Returns:

getDegrees

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getDegrees()
Returns the list of degrees. On directed graphs this list is the sum of in-degrees and out-degrees values

Returns:
list of degrees

getInDegrees

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getInDegrees()
Returns the list of in-degrees of directed graph.

Returns:
list of in-degrees

getOutDegrees

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getOutDegrees()
Returns the list of out-degrees of directed graph.

Returns:
list of out-degrees

getResults

public java.util.List<int[]> getResults(int type)
Returns statistics about degrees.

Parameters:
type - of required statistics DEGREE, IN_DEGREE, OUT_DEGREE (the last two are for directed graphs only)
Returns:
list of integer fields with two numbers, the first one is the degree and the second one is the number of vertices with this degree
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the type is not one of: DEGREE, IN_DEGREE, OUT_DEGREE

saveResults

public void saveResults(java.lang.String template)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Saves results to files. This method generates text files containing results of statistics. For undirected graphs two files are created: template_deg.txt and template_info.txt. For directed graphs four files are created: template_[deg/in/out].txt and template_info.txt.

Parameters:
template - common name for all generated files
Throws:
java.io.IOException - on error when saving

analyze

public void analyze()
Generates info about the structure.
